Package ohos.agp.components.listcomponent

Class ItemTouchExpandCallback

  • java.lang.Object
    • ohos.agp.components.listcomponent.ItemTouchExpandCallback

  • public abstract class ItemTouchExpandCallback
extends Object
    Functions as a bridge between users and the ItemTouchExpand object.

    You can use this class to customize the behavior of the ItemTouchExpand object, for example, dragging or swiping. A callback is invoked when the customized behavior is executed.

    Since:
    7

      protected static class  ItemTouchExpandCallback.ItemTouchExpandCallbackCleaner
      Implements the release of the ItemTouchExpandCallback object.

    • Constructor Detail

      • ItemTouchExpandCallback

        public ItemTouchExpandCallback​(int dragDirs,
                               int swipeDirs)
        A constructor used to create a ItemTouchExpandCallback instance.
        Parameters:
        dragDirs - Indicates the drag directions, which must be a combination of ItemTouchExpand#LEFT, ItemTouchExpand#RIGHT, ItemTouchExpand#START, ItemTouchExpand#END, ItemTouchExpand#UP and ItemTouchExpand#DOWN.
        swipeDirs - Indicates the swipe directions, which must be a combination of ItemTouchExpand#LEFT, ItemTouchExpand#RIGHT, ItemTouchExpand#START, ItemTouchExpand#END, ItemTouchExpand#UP, and ItemTouchExpand#DOWN.
        Since:
        7

    • Method Detail

      • getNativePtr

        public long getNativePtr​()
        Obtains the native object.
        Returns:
        Returns the native object.

      • onMove

        public abstract boolean onMove​(ListComponent listContainer,
                               ComponentOwner componentOwner,
                               ComponentOwner target)
        Called when a component is being dragged from a position to another in the provider.
        Parameters:
        listContainer - Indicates the ListComponent bound to the ItemTouchExpand instance.
        componentOwner - Indicates the current ComponentOwner of the component that is being dragged.
        target - Indicates the new ComponentOwner of the component.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the component is moved to the new position; returns false otherwise.
        Since:
        7

      • onSwipeDetected

        public abstract void onSwipeDetected​(ComponentOwner componentOwner,
                                     int direction)
        Called when a component is swiped.
        Parameters:
        componentOwner - Indicates the ComponentOwner of the component that is swiped.
        direction - Indicates the swipe direction, which can be ItemTouchExpand#UP, ItemTouchExpand#DOWN, ItemTouchExpand#LEFT, or ItemTouchExpand#RIGHT.
        Since:
        7

      • setLongPressDragAllowed

        public void setLongPressDragAllowed​(boolean longPressDragEnabled)
        Sets whether this ItemTouchExpand instance should start dragging for a component that is being long pressed.
        Parameters:
        longPressDragEnabled - Specifies whether to start dragging for a component that is being long pressed. The value true means to start dragging in such a case, and false means the opposite. The default value is true.
        Since:
        7

      • getLongPressDragAllowed

        public boolean getLongPressDragAllowed​()
        Checks whether this ItemTouchExpand instance should start dragging for a component that is being long pressed.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the ItemTouchExpand instance should start dragging in such a case; returns false otherwise.
        Since:
        7

        Parameters:

        Since:
        7

        componentOwner - Indicates the ComponentOwner of the component that is being dragged.
        target - Indicates the target ComponentOwner.

                          float swipeLimit)
        Sets the threshold for trigger swiping for a component.
        Parameters:
        componentOwner - Indicates the ComponentOwner of the component to swipe.
        swipeLimit - Indicates the threshold to set.

      • getSwipeLimit

        public float getSwipeLimit​(ComponentOwner componentOwner)
        Obtains the threshold for triggering swiping for a component.
        Parameters:
        componentOwner - Indicates the ComponentOwner of the component that is being swiped.
        Returns:
        Returns the threshold if obtained; returns 0 if componentOwner is null.

      • selectDropObjective

        public ComponentOwner selectDropObjective​(ComponentOwner selected,
                                          List<ComponentOwner> dropTargets,
                                          int curX,
                                          int curY)
        Chooses a component among a list of ComponentOwners that is closest to the one specified by selected and exchanges their positions.
        Parameters:
        selected - Indicates the ComponentOwner of the component that is being dragged.
        dropTargets - Indicates the list of ComponentOwners from which a component will be chosen as the candidate.
        curX - Indicates the distance to be dragged in the horizontal direction.
        curY - Indicates the distance to be dragged in the vertical direction.
        Returns:
        Returns the ComponentOwner of the chosen component; returns null otherwise.
        Since:
        7

      • onSelectedItemUpdated

        public void onSelectedItemUpdated​(ComponentOwner componentOwner,
                                  int actionState)
        Called when the component being swiped or dragging is updated.
        Parameters:
        componentOwner - Indicates the ComponentOwner of the component that is being swiped or dragged.
        actionState - Indicates the action state of the ItemTouchExpand instance, which can be ItemTouchExpand#ITEM_TOUCH_IDLE_STATE, ItemTouchExpand#ITEM_TOUCH_SWIPE_STATE, or ItemTouchExpand#ITEM_TOUCH_DRAG_STATE.
        Since:
        7

        public int getAssumedSwipeDirections​(ListComponent listContainer,
                                     ComponentOwner componentOwner)
        Obtains the default swipe directions of a component.
        Parameters:
        listContainer - Indicates the ListComponent bound to the ItemTouchExpand instance.
        componentOwner - Indicates the ComponentOwner of the component to swipe.
        Returns:
        Returns the directions if obtained; returns 0 if componentOwner is null.

        Returns the directions if obtained; returns 0 if componentOwner is null.

      • setMarginOfOverlapRegion

        public void setMarginOfOverlapRegion​(int marginOfBoundingBox)
        Sets the margin around the boundaries of the dragged component. The margin is used to calculate the overlapped area between the dragged component and the target component, based on which an exchange between the components can be triggered.
        Parameters:
        marginOfBoundingBox - Indicates the margin to set.
        Since:
        7

      • getMarginOfOverlapRegion

        public int getMarginOfOverlapRegion​()
        Obtains the margin, which is used to calculate the overlapped area that can trigger the exchange between the dragged component and the target component.
        Returns:
        Returns the margin if obtained; returns 0 if an exception occurs.
        Since:
        7

      • getAnimationTimePeriod

        public long getAnimationTimePeriod​(ListComponent listContainer,
                                   int animationType,
                                   float xCoordinateOffset,
                                   float yCoordinateOffset)
        Obtains the duration of an animation.

        This method is called by the ItemTouchCallback instance when the operation on a component is complete.

        Parameters:
        listComponent - Indicates the ListComponent bound to the ItemTouchExpand instance
        animationType - Indicates the animation type, which can be ItemTouchExpand#DRAG_ANIMATION_TYPE, ItemTouchExpand#SWIPE_CANCEL_ANIMATION_TYPE, or ItemTouchExpand#SWIPE_SUCCESS_ANIMATION_TYPE.
        xCoordinateOffset - Indicates the distance that the animation will move in the horizontal direction.
        yCoordinateOffset - Indicates the distance that the animation will move in the vertical direction.
        Returns:
        Returns the duration if obtained; returns 0 if an exception occurs.
        Since:
        7
